definition: profound theory (in Daoism and Buddhism)/mysterious principles

sentences.english: His rise offers little insight either.
sentences.chinese: 他的崛起也沒有多少玄機了。

sentences.english: After they cut through more layers of steel, a hidden trap finally appeared.
sentences.chinese: 又鋸掉了幾層鋼板之後，一個暗藏的玄機終於顯露。

sentences.english: The universe is an immense body of mystery mechanism formed by space-time and life.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙是由時空和生命構成的巨大的玄機體。

sentences.english: Herein lies the special status of US government securities.
sentences.chinese: 這裏面的玄機是美國政府債券的特殊地位。

sentences.english: Getting just one element opens strategies for exploring the document.
sentences.chinese: 只取得一個元素爲探索文檔開啓了玄機。
這些問題其實暗藏玄機。

sentences.english: The trick is what the camera does with the incoming light.
sentences.chinese: 玄機在於相機如何處理進來的光。

sentences.english: People obsessed with Mona Lisa smile, the Mona Lisa eyes hidden mystery.
sentences.chinese: 蒙娜麗莎微笑讓人迷戀，蒙娜麗莎雙眼暗藏玄機。

sentences.english: Even his body kept its secrets.
sentences.chinese: 甚至他的身體裏也暗藏玄機。

sentences.english: We have one cavity warm blood, action is the mystery.
sentences.chinese: 我們光有一腔熱血不行，行動是致勝的玄機。

sentences.english: Federal and state fisheries biologists are looking into the mystery.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦與地方漁業生物學家正在研究當中的玄機。

definition: mystery known only to heaven (archaic)/inscrutable twist of fate/fig. top secret
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
meaning (implicit in a phrase)/implied meaning/hidden meaning/hint/connotation
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
to explain/to illustrate/to indicate/to show/to prove/explanation/directions/caption/CL:個|个[ge4]
inadvertent/accidental/to have no intention of (doing sth)
